ARABIC: رَحْمَةً مِّن رَّبِّكَ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: as a mercy from your Lord. He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: A mercy from your Lord. Verily He is all-hearing and all-knowing,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: as a Mercy from your Lord. Surely He is All-Hearing, All-Seeing,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: as a mercy (for the human being) from your Lord. Your Lord is All-hearing and All-knowing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: A mercy from your Lord; indeed He only is the All Hearing, the All Knowing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: (As) a mercy from your Lord. Verily, He is the All-Hearer, the All-Knower.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: A mercy from your Lord, surely He is the Hearing, the Knowing,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: as a mercy from thy Lord (surely He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: A mercy from thy Lord. Lo! He, even He is the Hearer, the Knower,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: as a mercy from your Lord, He hears all and knows all,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: A mercy from thy Lord. Verily He! He is the Hearer, the Knower.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: as a mercy from your Lord—indeed He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing—
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: As Mercy from thy Lord: for He hears and knows (all things);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: (As) a Mercy from your Lord. Verily! He is the All-Hearer, the All-Knower.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: A Mercy from your Lord, He is the Hearer, the Knower.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: As mercy from your Lord. He is the Hearer, the Knower.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: As mercy from your Lord. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [44:6] as a mercy, out of compassion for those to whom these [messengers] have been sent. Surely He is the Hearer, of their sayings, the Knower, of their actions.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (A mercy) a blessing (from thy Lord) to His slaves, i.e. sending messengers with scriptures to them is a blessing from their Lord. (Lo! He is the Hearer) of the saying of the Quraysh when they said: "Our Lord relieve us of the torment", (the Knower) of them and of their punishment,
